page.title: 09NEW IBSTOCK SURGERY _ 1
page.content: The new doctors' surgery,{Ibstock {House,}was opened in February, 1985. It was built on High Street in less than a year at a cost of Â£220,000 and will be paid for by the four doctors who own the practice. Designed by a Leicester firm of architects, it was built to replace the old surgery in Overton Road which was cold, damp, dark and cramped. The new surgery has ten times as much floor space as the old building. Each doctor has a separate consulting room and other facilities include a common room, treatment room (used by the district nurse), reception area and storage areas. Both doctors and patients are very enthusiastic about their spacious new surgery.
